intro: Salvia officinalis var. icterina, commonly known as lemon sage, is a variant of the common sage plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aromatic, slightly lemon-scented leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in herbal medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to its parent species. Its unique color and fragrance make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
